channel.title: Food Timers
channel.description: Hi, Does any1 has Food timers that works and could give me it, I really need it..I hate those mass eaters :S

item.title: Food Timers
item.dc:creator: @redrover redrover
item.description:
@redrover wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:7, topic:163003”]Cough, nothing to do with it cough…

case 391://MantaRay For Example…
if (actionTimer == 0) {
//healingStuff
actionTimer = 23; //How long before u can eat each manta…
}
break;[/quote]

Haha, ty
I did with actionAmount++; Worked also, but u loses wep xD

Read full topic

item.title: Food Timers

item.description:
@redrover wrote:

Got some errors like this

client.java:28118: 'class' or 'interface' expected
        public boolean resetHE() {
               ^
client.java:29406: 'class' or 'interface' expected
                public PlayerSave loadMythgame(String playerName, String playerP
ass)
                       ^
client.java:31287: 'class' or 'interface' expected
}
^
client.java:31287: 'class' or 'interface' expected
}
   ^
4 errors
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

G2g

item.title: Food Timers
item.dc:creator: @dd1 dd
item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

Hey, I didn’t realize it was you…

Find public boolean healing() {

Replace the whole boolean with:

public boolean healing() { if (healing[0] == 1) { actionAmount++; HTimer = 1; OriginalShield = playerEquipment[playerShield]; OriginalWeapon = playerEquipment[playerWeapon]; //playerEquipment[playerShield] = -1; //playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = -1; setAnimation(0x33D); healing[0] = 2; } if (HTimer <= 0 && healing[0] == 2) { deleteItem(healing[4], GetItemSlot(healing[4]), 1); int Heal = healing[1]; int HealDiff = (healing[2] - healing[1]); if (HealDiff > 0) { Heal += misc.random(HealDiff); } if (healing[3] != -1) { addItem(healing[3], 1); } NewHP =( playerLevel[playerHitpoints] + Heal); if (NewHP > getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints])) { NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints]); } sendMessage("You eat the "+GetItemName(healing[4])+"."); playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = OriginalWeapon; playerEquipment[playerShield] = OriginalShield; resetAnimation(); resetHE(); } return true; } public b[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2007, 04:01:44 PM[/size][hr]Oh, make sure you make backups incase you get errors.

Read full topic
